results.title: The Great primitives. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Auguste Lumiere, Louis Lumiere and Jason Films Productions
results.brief_description: A collection of excerpts from some early pioneer films made between 1895-1912. The films included are; “Lumiere Premiere Program”, made in 1895; “A Trip to the Moon”, made in 1902; “Great Train Robbery”, made in 1903; and, a series of animations done by Cohl between 1908-1912.

results.title: The Great Plains
results.creator_credit: Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the prairie region of Canada, showing the varied occupations of farmers and townsmen throughout the year. Prepared primarily for classroom use, the film employs live photography, animation, and in the historical sequences, painting to tell the story of the plains from early days of settlement to such recent developments as the oil industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Great New Zealand Fishing Safari
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Action Downunder”.
Geoff Thomas and his guests travel throughout New Zealand in search of the best fishing. He and his guests journey to some of New Zealand’s most spectacular locations in search of striped marlin, rainbow trout, mako sharks, snapper and many more. One in a series of films which capture some of the world’s most exciting fishing action.

results.title: The Great Muppet caper
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Frank Oz, David Lazer and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Kermit and Fozzie Bear star as twin reporters, who together with the rest of the Muppet gang travel to Great Britain in search of jewel thieves. Catching the guilty culprits seems to be the only action to redeem themselves with their boss for letting the thieves escape under their very noses. During their stay Kermit meets Miss Piggy posing as fashion designer Lady Holiday (Diana Rigg), the woman whose gems have been stolen. While the Muppets are in Britain another of Lady Holiday’s diamonds is stolen and Miss Piggy is arrested on suspicion of theft. Now there is even more at stake than their jobs as the Muppets race to clear Miss Piggy’s name and stop another theft from occurring. Features cameos by Peter Falk, John Cleese, Peter Ustinov and others.

results.title: The Great Mr. Handel
results.creator_credit: Norman Walker, Jas B Sloan and G H W Productions
results.brief_description: A costume drama about one of the world’s most loved composers this film, set in 1741, is about George Frederick Handel’s creation of the most popular choral works since that time - The Messiah. This amazing work was completed in three weeks. Wilfred Lawson stars as Handel, and as this beautiful period piece was one of the early Technicolour films to be produced in Britain, it makes for delightful viewing.

results.title: The Great mouse detective
results.creator_credit: John Musker, David Michener, Burny Mattinson, Ron Clements and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Early computer animated Disney feature, features the mellifluous tones of Vincent Price as Professor Rattigan, a Sherlock Homes type character who is a master of mystery sleuthing. Set in Victoria London, England Rattigan (a highly intelligent scientific mouse) is joined by various cohorts on the trail of the abducted father of a little mouse. An entertaining effort directed at children, that charms in many ways with its gentle humour and fun characterisations.

results.title: The Great Moghuls
results.creator_credit: Douglas Rae, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Ecosse Films
results.brief_description: This spectacular and elegant documentary series, written and presented by Bamber Gascoigne, tells the dramatic story of the rise and fall of the Moghul Empire. Filmed in some of the most beautiful locations in the world it features an astonishing dynasty. Over six generations, father to son, they captured, consolidated, profoundly influenced and then lost control of the vast sub-continent of India. The discovery of the six great Moghuls as individuals, together with their fantastic achievements will come as a revelation. While the storyline is more akin to “Dynasty”, the visual treats are in the league of the legendary television arts series “Civilisation”.

results.title: The Great Mill race
results.creator_credit: Robin Crichton and Edinburgh Film Productions
results.brief_description: An unusual look at the Scottish woollen industry. A fictional race is organised between a number of mills to produce a tweed suit in record time. Follows the race from sheep-shearing to finished article.
results.description: An unusual look at the Scottish woollen industry. A fictional race is organised between a number of mills to produce a tweed suit in record time. Follows the race from sheep-shearing to finished article.

results.title: The Great Macarthy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Baker and Stony Creek Films
results.brief_description: The hilarious story of Macarthy (John Jarratt) a nice young fellow, his life, loves and our Great Australian game, Aussie Rules Football. Macarthy is the local football star who is scouted by the tycoon president of a leading football club. He leaves his home town (where he’s lived all his life) and is taken to the bright lights of the big city where he begins to lead a life of fame and debauchery. An acclaimed comedy in a similar vein to “The Club” by David Williamson. Also available on VHS [308069].
